alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 14 at 2:06PM MDT until April 14 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 8 PM MDT TODAY FOR MUCH OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THROUGH 6 PM SATURDAY FOR THE SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS AS WELL AS THE CENTRAL HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Critical fire weather conditions will continue through mid evening across much of eastern New Mexico thanks to above normal temperatures, moderate to high Haines indices, very low humidity values and gusty westerly winds. Critical fire weather conditions will redevelop Saturday across the Sandia and Manzano Mountains as well as the Central Highlands. Strong northwest winds are expected to develop behind a cold front and though temperatures are not expected to be as high as today, dewpoints will lower considerably. Thus, several hours of single digit humidity values are expected on Saturday. Winds will decrease late in the afternoon to alleviate the critical fire weather concerns. However, widespread critical fire weather conditions are possible again mid week. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (Zone 104) and East Central Plains (Zone 126) through this evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts near 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 9 to 14 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
